value.message:
ci(lighthouse): bump Node to 22, run Chrome under Xvfb, and relax LHCI timeouts

- Update workflow NODE_VERSION to 22
- Install and start Xvfb in the workflow and set DISPLAY for lhci
- Add headless Chrome flags and set maxWaitForLoad in lighthouserc
- Increase startServerReadyTimeout to 60000
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message: fix(ci): use dist directory in deploy-optimized workflow
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message: chore(scripts): add root preview script to run @tailwindspark/demo-app workspace
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
fix(security): resolve CodeQL code scanning alerts

- Replace Math.random() with crypto.getRandomValues() for secure API key generation
- Add proper regex anchors to hostname patterns in service worker
- Remove unused stdout/stderr variables in performance-test.mjs
- Configure CodeQL to exclude generated files (reports, dist, coverage)

Fixes security alerts #1-4, #11-13, and addresses #5-10, #14-20
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
chore: no-op update — processed change entries but there were no code changes

Processed the incoming change entries and found no modifications to source files.
This commit acts as a placeholder to record that the change feed was handled,
but no actual code or content changes were made.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
feat: add local performance testing script using Lighthouse CI

- Implemented a new script for running performance tests locally.
- The script builds the project, starts a preview server, and runs Lighthouse tests on specified URLs.
- Results are saved in a structured format, including individual scores and a summary report.
- Added recommendations based on performance scores to improve web application quality.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message: Implement feature X to enhance user experience and fix bug Y in module Z
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Fix React hooks rule violations for eslint-plugin-react-hooks v7.0.0

- Replace window.location.hash direct assignment with setTimeout wrapper to avoid react-hooks/immutability violations
- Convert useState + useEffect pattern to useMemo for filtered products to avoid react-hooks/set-state-in-effect violations
- Add wrapper functions for filter/search/sort changes that reset pagination properly
- Remove unnecessary useEffect that violated the new stricter React hooks rules

Breaking changes in eslint-plugin-react-hooks v7.0.0:
- Stricter immutability rules for external objects
- No direct setState calls in useEffect bodies
- Improved detection of problematic patterns

All React hooks rule violations are now resolved while maintaining functionality.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Add MPL-2.0 license to allowed licenses for dependency review

- Resolves dependency-review failures for lightningcss package
- MPL-2.0 is compatible with our project license requirements
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
feat(tests): add comprehensive tests for Card, Form, and Modal components

- Implemented unit tests for Card component including rendering, variants, padding, header, footer, and ref forwarding.
- Added tests for Form components (Input, Textarea, Select, Checkbox, Radio) covering rendering, error handling, helper text, and event handling.
- Created tests for Modal component ensuring proper rendering, close functionality, size classes, and event handling.
- Introduced increment-version script to automate patch version updates in package.json.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
fix: resolve dark mode functionality and improve build process

- Updated theme switching logic in ThemeContext to ensure proper toggling between light and dark modes.
- Replaced problematic `@apply` usage in CSS with direct CSS custom properties for body styling.
- Eliminated inline styles in MarketingPage.tsx by moving styles to CSS classes.
- Ensured consistent usage of semantic color tokens across components, particularly in Layout and MarketingPage.
- Verified build process for all assets, ensuring no inline styles remain and proper asset optimization.
- Documented changes and analysis for future reference.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message: style: Improve HTML formatting and structure in cache management pages
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Fix GitHub Pages caching issues causing blank page

- Update service worker cache version to v1.2.0 to force cache refresh
- Add cache control meta tags to index.html to prevent stale HTML caching
- Enhance Vite build config with explicit asset naming for better cache busting
- Add clear-cache.html utility page for users experiencing cache issues
- New JS bundle hash (index-e2MyGK1W.js) should resolve 404 errors

This addresses the blank page issue on refresh by ensuring browsers
load the correct, current version of assets instead of cached stale files.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Fix black placeholder images on ecommerce page

- Create local SVG placeholder image (placeholder-product.svg)
- Replace all /api/placeholder/400/300 URLs with local SVG
- Eliminates 404 errors causing black image display on GitHub Pages
- Adds simple, accessible placeholder with product icon and dimensions
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message: chore: remove unused color test HTML file
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Fix semantic text utilities for GitHub Pages

- Add explicit .text-text and .text-text-muted utilities to @layer utilities
- Ensures proper rendering of design system page headers and descriptions
- Follows same pattern as status color utilities fix
- Text colors now properly resolve to dark colors (#1c1917, #57534e) instead of faint grey
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message: feat: Enhance TailwindCSS v4 utilities and documentation for improved performance and usability
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
chore: upgrade dependencies and improve design tokens

- Updated jsdom to version 27.0.0 and tsx to version 4.20.5 in package.json.
- Added ajv as a new dependency.
- Removed unused success, warning, and error color definitions from tailwind.config.js.
- Added explicit status color utilities in theme.css for success, warning, and error states.
- Updated Button, Card, Form, and Modal components to use new design tokens and color utilities.
- Created a dummy safelist file to ensure status color utilities are generated correctly.
- Documented performance analysis and migration summary for TailwindCSS v4.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
content: Update Tailwind CSS version references from 3.4 to 4.1

- Updated HomePage.tsx technology stack section to reflect current Tailwind CSS 4.1
- Updated DemosPage.tsx technology list to show Tailwind CSS 4.1
- Ensures all website content accurately reflects current project state
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
docs: Update all documentation for Tailwind CSS v4 migration

- Updated README.md to reflect v4.1.13
- Enhanced ARCHITECTURE.md with @theme directive details
- Added v4 design token info to GETTING_STARTED.md
- Added comprehensive v1.2.0 release notes to CHANGELOG.md
- Completely rewrote demo app README with proper documentation
- Updated GitHub Copilot instructions for v4 guidelines
- Fixed markdown linting issues throughout
- Updated session summary with documentation review completion
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
feat: Upgrade to Tailwind CSS v4 and centralize design tokens

- Updated Tailwind CSS version across all packages to ^4.1.13.
- Introduced a centralized design tokens system in `packages/design-tokens/theme.css`.
- Replaced raw Tailwind color classes with semantic tokens in UI components.
- Enhanced Tailwind configuration to support dark mode and semantic color aliases.
- Added pre-build script to generate meta files for deployment.
- Implemented ESLint rule to disallow raw primary utility classes.
- Improved build scripts for asset revisioning and SRI generation.
- Fixed issues with dark/light mode functionality and routing behavior in the demo app.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
feat: Implement TailwindCSS v4 migration foundation

- Install TailwindCSS v4 alpha across monorepo packages
- Convert to CSS-first configuration with @theme directive
- Implement comprehensive color system (primary, accent, secondary, success, warning, error)
- Update PostCSS configuration to use @tailwindcss/postcss
- Preserve custom spacing, typography, and component layers
- Add comprehensive migration research and best practices documentation

Migration is 85% complete with solid foundation established.
Remaining: resolve native dependency blocker for full functionality.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message: docs: Add TailwindCSS v4 migration plan and best practices analysis

value.message:
Fix .gitignore and add missing public assets

- Removed public directory from .gitignore (was preventing Vite assets from being tracked)
- Added all public directory assets including:
  - site.webmanifest and sw.js with fixed relative paths
  - All favicon and icon files (TailwindSpark.png, favicon.ico, etc.)
  - SEO assets (robots.txt, sitemap.xml, og-image.svg, 404.html)
- These files are needed for proper GitHub Pages deployment
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Fix GitHub Pages 404 asset errors: Convert to relative paths

- Updated HTML favicon and manifest links from /tailwind-demo/ to relative paths
- Fixed site.webmanifest icons and scope to use relative paths
- Updated service worker cache URLs to use relative paths
- Fixed structured data logo reference from logo.png to TailwindSpark.png
- Resolves 404 errors for favicon.ico, TailwindSpark.png, site.webmanifest, sw.js
- All static assets now load correctly on GitHub Pages deployment
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Fix GitHub Actions build failure: Update Logo component to use BASE_URL for TailwindSpark.png

- Changed from problematic import statement to runtime path construction
- Uses import.meta.env.BASE_URL for proper Vite asset resolution
- Resolves Rollup build error: 'failed to resolve import /TailwindSpark.png'
- Build now completes successfully in both local and CI environments

value.message:
feat: Update React application with TailwindSpark branding and WebSpark integration

🎨 APPLICATION BRANDING OVERHAUL:

📱 Homepage Updates:
- Rebrand to 'TailwindSpark ✨' with professional tagline
- Add comprehensive WebSpark portfolio integration section
- Include links to PromptSpark, RecipeSpark, TriviaSpark apps
- Add Mark Hazleton attribution and philosophy quote
- Enhance feature descriptions with technical details

🧭 Navigation & Layout:
- Update header logo to TailwindSpark with ✨ icon
- Change color scheme from blue to purple/blue gradient
- Add comprehensive footer with WebSpark links
- Include professional profile and GitHub links
- Update navigation labels for better UX

📊 Dashboard Branding:
- Rebrand dashboard from 'PromptSpark' to 'TailwindSpark'
- Update user profile to Mark Hazleton with WebSpark creator role
- Add WebSpark portfolio link in sidebar
- Modernize dashboard description and welcome text

�� Component Pages:
- Update Design System page with production-ready messaging
- Enhance Animation page with interactive example badges
- Add educational context and Tailwind CSS documentation links
- Include TailwindSpark and WebSpark branding throughout

🔗 SEO & Professional Integration:
- Link to markhazleton.com professional profile
- Reference WebSpark evolution article
- Add comprehensive footer with portfolio links
- Include social proof and credibility indicators

This transforms the application from a simple demo into a professional portfolio showcase that demonstrates both technical expertise and real-world design patterns.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
feat: Rebrand as TailwindSpark and integrate with WebSpark portfolio

🌟 MAJOR BRANDING UPDATE: Transform to TailwindSpark

📝 Documentation Updates:
- Rebrand from 'Tailwind CSS Demo' to 'TailwindSpark'
- Add comprehensive WebSpark portfolio integration
- Include SEO-optimized metadata and keywords
- Add detailed author attribution and social links
- Enhance description with educational and professional context

📦 Package Updates:
- Update all package names to @tailwindspark/* namespace
- Add author information and homepage links
- Update build scripts and dependency references
- Maintain backward compatibility in workflows

🌐 SEO Optimization:
- Add comprehensive meta tags for search engines
- Include Open Graph and Twitter Card metadata
- Add canonical URLs and social media optimization
- Integrate with Mark Hazleton professional profile

🔗 Portfolio Integration:
- Link to WebSpark main portfolio site
- Reference other WebSpark applications (PromptSpark, RecipeSpark, TriviaSpark)
- Add professional background and philosophy
- Include comprehensive support and community links

This transforms the project from a simple demo into a professional portfolio piece that showcases both technical expertise and real-world application design patterns as part of the WebSpark ecosystem.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

- Provide alternative deployment options for Vercel and Netlify
